JobFullDesc: The Facebook Reality Labs team is helping more people around the world come together and connect through world-class AR/VR hardware and software. With global teams dedicated to AR/VR research, computer vision, haptics, social interaction, and more, Oculus is committed to driving the state-of-the-art forward through relentless innovation. The potential of AR/VR to change the world is immense and we’re just getting started. Our Technology Engineering for Devices (TED) team explores, develops, and delivers new cutting-edge technologies that serve as the foundation of current and future AR/VR products. From mixed reality and human interaction to natural inputs and beyond, TED is focused on transforming new technologies from early concept to product by iterating, prototyping, and realizing the human value and new experiences these technologies enable.The Depth HW team within TED develops high-performance depth solutions for FRL’s AR/VR products. This multidisciplinary group brings research to life by realizing state-of-the-art custom modules including mixed-signal ASICs, lasers, optics, and firmware. The Depth HW team is seeking a Lead Electrical Engineer for end-to-end ownership of R&D and production electrical engineering from early concepts  to mass production.  We are seeking an Electrical Engineer who has a passion for working across disciplines to transform research technologies into physical solutions. As an Electrical Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, simulation, implementation, and debug of mixed-signal ASICs, board-level circuitry, and systems used in our solutions. You will experiment with and develop novel solutions to complex electronics problems, working closely with cross functional partners  combining electronics, optics, mechanicals, and firmware.Responsible for the design, simulation, implementation, and debug of mixed-signal ASICs, board-level circuitry, and systems used in our solutions.Experiment with and develop novel solutions to complex electronics problems.Working closely with cross functional partners  combining electronics, optics, mechanicals, and firmware.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBS in Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience in electronic hardware development.Experience with system-level design including circuit design, PCB layout, system bring-up, integration, and debug.Experience with low-power analog circuit design, DC/DC converters, power management methods, A/D and D/A conversion.Experience with schematic capture and PCB design using Cadence OrCAD/Allegro or equivalent.Experience validating/verifying EE function blocks including Custom ASICs.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSBS in Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience in electronic hardware development.Experience with system-level design including circuit design, PCB layout, system bring-up, integration, and debug.Experience with low-power analog circuit design, DC/DC converters, power management methods, A/D and D/A conversion.Experience with schematic capture and PCB design using Cadence OrCAD/Allegro or equivalent.Experience validating/verifying EE function blocks including Custom ASICs.Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
